summary: This is a forwarded email chain from February 27, 2020, discussing logistical and financial arrangements for therapy sessions for Epstein victims in West Palm Beach. An FBI agent forwards a query from a trial attorney about whether the FBI will cover extended therapy sessions beyond the initial six and confirms reimbursement status for a therapist.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Author of the original email inquiring about FBI coverage for extended therapy sessions for Epstein victims and reimbursement for a therapist.

persons.name: T'l Edwards
persons.context: Listed as one of the Epstein victims receiving therapy in West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Pottinger
persons.context: Listed as one of the Epstein victims receiving therapy in West Palm Beach.

connections.description: Henderson, as a trial attorney, is inquiring about therapy coverage for Edwards, who is listed as an Epstein victim.
Henderson, as a trial attorney, is inquiring about therapy coverage for Pottinger, who is listed as an Epstein victim.

locations: Fort Lauderdale, Florida (425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2)
keyFacts: The FBI was covering therapy sessions for Epstein victims, with an initial limit of six sessions per victim.
A query was made about whether the FBI would cover extended therapy sessions beyond the initial six.
There was a need to confirm reimbursement for a therapist who had conducted sessions with the listed victims.
The document reveals ongoing support and logistical coordination for victims' mental health care following the Epstein case.
